item.title: Create Rule Groups
item.description:
This section introduces how to create an alert rule group.

The monitoring and alerting functions of KubeSphere are implemented based on Prometheus. Each rule group can contain multiple alert rules. You can create alert rules using the rule templates provided by the system or manually enter PromQL expressions to create alert rules. For more information, see the Prometheus Documentation.

Note

KubeSphere only supports creating custom rule groups, not built-in rule groups.

item.title: View Rule Group List
item.description:
This section introduces how to view the alert rule group list.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner of the page and click Whizard Observability Center.

  3. Click Global Alerts > Built-in Rule Groups/Custom Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

    • The rule group list provides the following information:

      Parameter Description

      Name

item.title: View Rule Group Details
item.description:
This section introduces how to view the details of an alert rule group.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner of the page and click Whizard Observability Center.

  3. Click Global Alerts > Built-in Rule Groups/Custom Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click the name of a rule group in the list to open its details page.

  5. View the resource attributes of the rule group in the Attributes area on the left side of the details page.

    Parameter Description

    Rule Group Status

item.title: Edit Rule Group Information
item.description:
This section introduces how to edit the information of an alert rule group.

You can edit the alias, check interval, and description of the alert rule group. KubeSphere does not support editing the name of a rule group.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner of the page and click Whizard Observability Center.

  3. Click Global Alerts > Built-in Rule Groups/Custom Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click on the right side of the rule group you need to edit, and then select Edit Information from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Edit Information dialog, set the basic information for the rule group, and then click OK.

    Parameter Description

    Alias

item.title: Edit Alert Rules
item.description:
This section describes how to edit alert rules in rule groups.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Steps

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner of the page and click Whizard Observability Center.

  3. Click Global Alerts > Built-in Rule Groups/Custom Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click on the right side of the rule group you need to edit, and then select Edit Alert Rules from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Edit Alert Rules dialog, edit existing alert rules or create new alert rules, and then click OK.

    • Hover over an existing alert rule and click the toggle switch to enable/disable the alert rule.

    • Hover over an existing alert rule and click to delete the alert rule.

    • Hover over an existing alert rule and click to modify the settings of the alert rule.

    • Click Add Alert Rule to create a new alert rule.

item.title: Disable and Enable Rule Groups
item.description:
This section describes how to enable and disable alerting rule groups. After a rule group is disabled, the system will no longer generate alerts based on the rule group.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

Disable and Enable a Single Rule Group

  1. Log in to the KubeSphere web console with a user having the platform-admin role.

  2. Click in the upper-right corner of the page and click Whizard Observability Center.

  3. Click Global Alerts > Built-in Rule Groups/Custom Rule Groups in the left navigation pane.

  4. Click on the right side of the rule group you need to disable, and then select Disable from the dropdown list.

  5. In the Disable Rule Group dialog, enter the name of the rule group, and then click OK.

  6. Click on the right side of the disabled rule group, and then select Enable from the dropdown list to enable the rule group.

item.title: Delete Custom Rule Groups
item.description:
This section describes how to delete alerting rule groups.

Note

KubeSphere only supports deleting custom rule groups, not built-in rule groups. You can reset built-in rule groups.
Warning

Rule groups cannot be recovered after deletion, so please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.

item.title: Reset Built-in Rule Groups
item.description:
This section describes how to reset built-in rule groups.

Note

KubeSphere only supports resetting built-in rule groups, not custom rule groups.
Warning

Rule groups cannot be recovered after resetting, so please proceed with caution.

Prerequisites

You should have the platform-admin role on the KubeSphere platform. For more information, see Users and Platform Roles.
